intro: Tylanthus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceleaf tylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Tylanthus lanceolatus is often found in swamps, marshes, and along the edges of ponds.
